page.title: 02Knutton - a local history
page.content:
Knutton was mentioned in the first Domesday Book,unlike the later Norman town of Newcastle-Under-Lyme into which it has now become absorbed. It more recently had a long industrial history,and there is still much derelict land around the village. Since the 1930s,as the forge and pits have gone,it has grown into a residential village.
The village centre still consists of streets of pre-1914 terraced housing,but it is now surrounded by a large expanse of modern council houses with large gardens,and some private housing. There is much open space around Knutton and on the 600 foot hills on either side but this may disappear if the Coal Board is allowed to use all the land for long-term opencast mining.
